Marie.name: Marie Dubois
Marie.background: Marie is a 45-year-old patient who is consulting for recurring headaches and fatigue. She works in an office and has two teenage children.
Marie.personality: Marie is polite, a bit anxious, and tends to ask many questions. She worries easily about her health.
Marie.circumstances: She made an appointment because her symptoms have persisted for two weeks and are affecting her work.
Marie.rules: She must be respectful towards the doctor and express her concerns clearly.

Dr. Martin.name: Dr. Pierre Martin
Dr. Martin.background: Dr. Martin is an experienced general practitioner with 25 years of experience. He is known for his empathetic approach and patience with his patients.
Dr. Martin.personality: He is very professional, empathetic, and takes time to listen to his patients. He explains things clearly and reassuringly.
Dr. Martin.circumstances: He practices in his private office and has a holistic approach to medicine.
Dr. Martin.rules: He must be polite, professional, ask relevant questions, and reassure the patient while remaining medically precise.

context.environment: A modern and welcoming medical office with a calm and professional atmosphere

turns.speaker: Marie
turns.text: Hello doctor, I've been having headaches for two weeks and I'm very tired.

turns.speaker: Dr. Martin
turns.text: I'm sorry to hear that, Marie. Can you tell me where the pain is strongest?

turns.speaker: Marie
turns.text: Mostly at the front of my head and behind my eyes.

turns.speaker: Dr. Martin
turns.text: I see. Have you been under a lot of stress lately?

turns.speaker: Marie
turns.text: Yes, work has been stressful and my sleep hasn't been great.

turns.speaker: Dr. Martin
turns.text: That could explain the tension. I'd like to check your blood pressure now.

turns.speaker: Dr. Martin
turns.text: Your blood pressure looks normal, but your neck muscles are very tense.

turns.speaker: Marie
turns.text: So it might just be stress?

turns.speaker: Dr. Martin
turns.text: Most likely. I recommend stretching, better sleep habits, and keeping a headache diary.

turns.speaker: Marie
turns.text: Thank you, doctor. I'll start doing that.

events.content: Hello doctor, I've been having headaches for two weeks and I'm very tired.
I'm sorry to hear that, Marie. Can you tell me where the pain is strongest?
Mostly at the front of my head and behind my eyes.
I see. Have you been under a lot of stress lately?
Yes, work has been stressful and my sleep hasn't been great.
That could explain the tension. I'd like to check your blood pressure now.
Your blood pressure looks normal, but your neck muscles are very tense.
So it might just be stress?
Most likely. I recommend stretching, better sleep habits, and keeping a headache diary.
Thank you, doctor. I'll start doing that.
